rules.title: Patient Status Inquiry
rules.action: Ask if the patient is new or established.
rules.example: Are you a new patient or have you visited us before?

rules.title: Acknowledge Patient Status
rules.condition: After the patient provides their status (new/established).
rules.action: Acknowledge the patient's status before requesting relevant information.
rules.example: Thank you. Since you're an established patient, I'll need some information to pull up your chart.

rules.title: Request ID for Chart
rules.action: Request identifying information (e.g., phone number or date of birth) to locate their patient chart.
rules.example: Could you please provide your phone number or date of birth so I can locate your chart?

rules.title: Acknowledge ID & Retrieve Chart
rules.condition: After receiving identifying information from an established patient.
rules.action: Acknowledge receipt and inform the user that their chart is being pulled up.
rules.example: Got it, thank you. Please give me a moment while I pull up your chart.

rules.title: Confirm Appointment Reason
rules.action: Confirm the reason for the appointment.
rules.example: I see you're due for your annual check-up. Is that what you're calling about, or is there another reason for your visit?

rules.title: Insurance Inquiry
rules.example: Do you have health insurance that you'll be using for this visit?

rules.title: Acknowledge Details & Inquire Availability
rules.condition: After identifying the specific type of appointment and any additional medical concerns.
rules.action: Acknowledge the details and inquire about the user's availability for scheduling.
rules.example: Okay, I understand you're looking to schedule a follow-up for your rash, and you also mentioned some stomach discomfort. What days and times work best for you?

rules.title: Offer Specific Appointment Time
rules.condition: After the patient has provided their availability or the agent has checked the schedule for suitable openings.
rules.action: Propose a specific date and time for the appointment to the patient.
rules.example: We have an opening for your annual check-up on Tuesday, November 9th at 2:00 PM. Does that work for you?

rules.title: Check Staff Availability Process
rules.condition: When a caller requests to check another person's availability.
rules.action: Ask for the caller's name and reason, inform them of a brief hold, and offer alternative assistance if the requested person is unavailable.
rules.example: Certainly, who may I say is calling and what is this regarding? I'll check if Dr. Smith is available; please hold briefly. If she's not, would you like to leave a message or schedule a call back?
